com.swfm.mica
Class MiEvent

java.lang.Object
  com.swfm.mica.MiEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
MiiEventTypes
public class MiEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements MiiEventTypes

This class implements the complete description of all events coming from the resisdent window system that are used by Mica. This includes user events (like keyboard presses and mouse button clicks and mouse movements), window manager events (like window destroy, exposed and moved/resized). In addition, some Mica-specific events also exist (the timer, idle and no-longer-idle events).

Each event is identified by 3 values: the type, the key and the modifiers. The type value identifies the 'type' of the event, the key value specifies which key in a Mi_KEY_PRESS_EVENT, Mi_KEY_EVENT, or Mi_KEY_RELEASE_EVENT and the modifiers value specifies which shift keys were held down when the event was generated.

Each event contains information about where the event occured, in device space and world space. This coordinate information is maintained in three 'formats': the point where the event occured, the area (footprint) where the event occured, and the distance (vector) from where the last event occurred. This information is appropriately transformed so that when delivered to a MiPart, the device and world values will be correct with respect to the MiPart. 

 Event types sequences for (any) mouse are:

 Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DOWN_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_UP_EVENT
 Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DOWN_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_CLICK_EVENT
 Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DOWN_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_CLICK_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DOWN_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DBLCLICK_EVENT
 Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DOWN_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_START_DRAG_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_DRAG_EVENT -> Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_UP_EVENT

Version:
%I% %G%
Author:
Michael L. Davis

public MiEvent()

MiEvent

public MiEvent(int type)
Constructs a new MiEvent with the given type. The key and modifiers are set to zero.

Parameters:
type - the event type

               int key,
               int modifiers)
Constructs a new MiEvent with the given type, key and modifiers.

Parameters:
type - the event type
key - the keyboard key
modifiers - the shift keys that were held down

MiEvent

public MiEvent(int type,
               int key,
               int modifiers,
               boolean usedForEventTypeOnly)
Constructs a new MiEvent with the given type, key and modifiers. If this is used only for type-key-modifier comparisons, then by setting the usedForEventTypeOnly parameter, positional information objects will not be created which will save time and memory. MiEventHandlers specify their event->command mappings using these optimized events.

Parameters:
type - the event type
key - the keyboard key
modifiers - the shift keys that were held down
usedForEventTypeOnly - true if no locational information will be required for this event.

MiEvent

public MiEvent(MiEvent other)
Constructs a new MiEvent which will be a copy of the given event.

Parameters:
other - the event to make a copy of
Method Detail

getLastEvent

public static MiEvent getLastEvent()
Gets the last event generated by Mica based on an event sent by the underlying window system. This is useful when one wants to create an event that is populated with correct and recent data (i.e. 
 MiEvent myEvent = new MiEvent(MiEvent.getLastEvent())

Returns:
the last event

setPreferredMouseFootPrintWidth

public static void setPreferredMouseFootPrintWidth(double size)
Sets the width and height of the mouse cursor pick point in pixels. This is used globally for all picks in Mica. This can be set on a part by part basis using MiPart.setMinimumPickAreaSize because this is often only useful in graphics editors, and can be misleading when near, say, a sash, which requires a pinpoint mouse footprint.

Parameters:
size - the size of the mouse cursor pick
See Also:
getPreferredMouseFootPrintWidth()

Gets the width and height of the mouse cursor pick point in pixels.

Returns:
the size of the mouse cursor pick

getModifiers

public int getModifiers()
Gets the modifiers of this event. See MiiEventTypes for a list of all modifiers. The possible values are: Mi_SHIFT_KEY_HELD_DOWN Mi_CONTROL_KEY_HELD_DOWN Mi_ALT_KEY_HELD_DOWN Mi_META_KEY_HELD_DOWN Mi_LOCK_KEY_HELD_DOWN Mi_ANY_MODIFIERS_HELD_DOWN

getMouseButtonState

public int getMouseButtonState()
Gets a mask indicating which mouse buttons are pressed during this event. The possible values are: Mi_LEFT_MOUSE_BUTTON_HELD_DOWN Mi_MIDDLE_MOUSE_BUTTON_HELD_DOWN Mi_RIGHT_MOUSE_BUTTON_HELD_DOWN Mi_MIDDLE_PLUS_RIGHT_MOUSE_BUTTON_HELD_DOWN

Returns:
which mouse buttons are down

setMovedKeyboardFocusTo

public void setMovedKeyboardFocusTo(MiPart part)
Specifies that the given MiPart has just received keyboard (and possibly enter-key) focus because of this event. This is useful for event handlers who behave differently if their MiPart is just now recieving keyboard focus.

Parameters:
part - the part that now has keyboard focus or null
See Also:
getMovedKeyboardFocusTo()

equalsEventType

public boolean equalsEventType(int otherType,
                               int otherKey,
                               int otherModifiers)
Gets whether this event has the same type, key and modifiers as the given type, key and modifiers. If either this event's modifiers or the given modifiers parameter is equal to Mi_ANY_MODIFIERS_HELD_DOWN, then this acts like a wild card and matches (equals) all other modifiers values.

Parameters:
otherType - the given type to compare to
otherKey - the given key to compare to
otherModifiers - the given modifiers to compare to
Returns:
true if this MiEvent equals the given parameters

canCompressEvents

public boolean canCompressEvents(MiEvent other)
Gets whether the given event can be combined into this event. This is generally true for all mouse motion events. This is useful when events are occurring faster than we can process them; if we compress some of these events so that we have to process fewer of them then we will be more likely able to keep up with them.

Parameters:
other - the event we may be able to compress into this one.
Returns:
true if this event and the given other event can be combined

compressEvent

public MiEvent compressEvent(MiEvent other)
Compresses (combines) the given event into this event.

Parameters:
other - the event we compress into this one.
Returns:
this event after compressing with the given event

interpretEvent

public boolean interpretEvent(java.awt.Event event,
                              MiCanvas canvas)
Process the given AWT event and initialize this MiEvent from the information it contains and other information that is maintained locally. Note that targetPart and targetList are not set here (not until this event is sent to a root window).

Parameters:
event - the java.awt.Event
canvas - the MiCanvas that is recevied the event from the AWT.
Returns:
true if the event was usable

newEvent

public static MiEvent newEvent()
Gets an instance of MiEvent from the cache. Creates a new MiEvent if the cache is empty. Calls init() on event sretrieved from the cache.

Returns:
An event ready to use.

freeEvent

public static void freeEvent(MiEvent e)
Returns an instance of MiEvent to the cache.

Parameters:
e - the event

stringToEvent

public static boolean stringToEvent(java.lang.String string,
                                    MiEvent event)
Sets given event type, key and modifiers from the given string description. Valid strings are of form: 
 "a"
 "a"
 "Ctrl+a"
 "CtrlShifta"
 "Ctrl+Space"
 "Ctrl+"

Parameters:
string - the text to translate to an event
event - the event to set from the string
Returns:
true if the text was mapped to an event (otherwise the text was invalid).
See Also:
eventToString(com.swfm.mica.MiEvent)

eventToString

public static java.lang.String eventToString(MiEvent event)
Gets a string description of the given event.

Parameters:
event - the event to translate to a string
Returns:
the string describing the event
See Also:
stringToEvent(java.lang.String, com.swfm.mica.MiEvent)
